data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Men honor what lies within the sphere of their knowledge, but do not realize how dependent they are on what lies beyond it.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Flow with whatever may happen and let your mind be free. Stay centered by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: All existing things are really one. We regard those that are beautiful and rare as valuable, and those that are ugly as foul and rotten The foul and rotten may come to be transformed into what is rare and valuable, and the rare and valuable into what is foul and rotten.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: I dreamed I was a butterfly, flitting around in the sky; then I awoke. Now I wonder: Am I a man who dreamt of being a butterfly, or am I a butterfly dreaming that I am a man?

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Where can I find a man who has forgotten words so I can have a word with him?

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Those who realize their folly are not true fools.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Those who seek to satisfy the mind of man by hampering it with ceremonies and music and affecting charity and devotion have lost their original nature.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: We cling to our own point of view, as though everything depended on it. Yet our opinions have no permanence; like autumn and winter, they gradually pass away.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Rewards and punishments are the lowest form of education.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: I know the joy of fishes in the river through my own joy, as I go walking along the same river.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Great wisdom is generous; petty wisdom is contentious. Great speech is impassioned, small speech cantankerous.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Cherish that which is within you, and shut off that which is without; for much knowledge is a curse.

data.author: Zhuangzi
data.en: Life comes from the earth and life returns to the earth.
